channel.title: How do i do order of operation with fractions!

item.title: How do i do order of operation with fractions!
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

this is how i learnt it
b solve brackets first
o then do “of” eg. half of 36
d ** division
m ** multiplication
a ****addition
s **** subtraction

** the order doesnt matter for the two. eg. 5 * 4 / 10
you dont do division first. multiplication is first do do it first.
**** same as above what comes first out of addition and subtration do them first.

hope this helps.

Read full topic

@darkilla wrote:

you just have to remember BEDMAS that is the order…
B bracket
E exponent
D divide
M multiply
A addition
S subtract

item.source: How do i do order of operation with fractions!

item.title: How do i do order of operation with fractions!
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Hex Key, post:8, topic:85136”]1/0 != 0

its infinity[/quote]

I think that is arguable. You can, of course, state that the limit as x approaches 0 of a/x is infinity, but that implies that 1/0 → ∞, not 1/0 = ∞. Arithmetic is defined on the premise that all values used are real. Infinity cannot be defined as a real number, but an upper limit to all real numbers. Thus, 1/0 does not exist in terms of real numbers.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do order of operation with fractions!

item.title: How do i do order of operation with fractions!
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

[quote=“OwnerShadow, post:3, topic:85136”]Order of Operations tells us what? Multiplecation then division then addition then subtraction

Example:

4*2-3+4

Order of Operations:

4*2-3+4
8-3+4

Order of Operations:

8-3+4
8-7

Order of Operations:
8-7
0

Your anwser: 0

Edit: Post your probelms[/quote]

1/0 != 0

its infinity

Read full topic

item.title: How do i do order of operation with fractions!
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Or something like this?
1 4 .
– X – + 45 – 5 (That is a “divide” symbol"
2 5 .

First, multiply:
1 4 4 2
– X – = – (reduced->) –
2 5 10 5

Second, divide: 45 divided by 5 equals 9

Third, put them together:
2 2
– + 9 = 9 – (<- that is your answer)
5 5

Read full topic

Order of Operations tells us what? Multiplecation then division then addition then subtraction

Example:

Order of Operations:

4*2-3+4
8-3+4

Order of Operations:

8-3+4
8-7

Order of Operations:
8-7
0

Your anwser: 0
